body: LEAD: NEW YEAR'S EVE festivities may seem like timeless traditions, but throughout most of history, Dec. 31 came and went with none of the hoopla that will envelop New York and elsewhere this weekend. title: 5,000 Colleagues Pay Tribute To Slain Officer in Brooklyn

title: Baby Taken in Foiled Robbery Is Recovered

body: LEAD: Kirkwood's Piquant Valentine Kirkwood's Piquant Valentine ''I made a mistake and wrote another play,'' said James Kirkwood, the author of ''Legends,'' which toured for 13 months with Mary Martin and Carol Channing but never opened in New York because - well, that's another story. title: On Stage

body: LEAD: A 12-year-old Brooklyn girl was shot and killed last night and a 14-year-old boy was seriously injured by machine-gun fire that erupted during a drug transaction in their neighborhood, the police said. title: Girl Killed in Drug Shooting

title: Anglicizing Yiddish Theater

body: LEAD: Many schools, libraries and churches have scheduled events to honor the 60th anniversary of the birth of the Rev. title: King Musical Celebrations: Where and When

body: LEAD: As the gentrification of Park Slope in Brooklyn continues, its major commercial artery, Seventh Avenue, is experiencing dramatic change. Small ethnic groceries and storefront service businesses are fast giving way to specialty grocers, upscale carryouts, wine shops, bars and trendy restaurants - from bagels to brioche, so to speak. As the
title: What's Cooking in Park Slope; Strolling Seventh Avenue With Food in Mind

body: LEAD: Park Slope has a large collection of Victorian town houses, one of America's greatest urban parks and a grand arch unlike any this side of the Arc de Triomphe. But perhaps the most notable hallmark of this central Brooklyn community is that, in many ways, it feels like a small, friendly college town. Park Slope has a large collection of
title: Small-Town Feeling on Brooklyn's Gold Coast

body: LEAD: The man charged in the murder of a pregnant pathologist at Bellevue Hospital Center was on probation for stealing a refrigerator in Brooklyn four years ago, and probation officials lost track of him last April, according to police and Probation Department records. title: Probation Dept. Had Lost Track of Suspect in Bellevue Slaying
